channel.title: Fun on TooNormal
channel.description: Recent content in Fun on TooNormal

item.title: Phat JS Demo
item.description: Here’s something different. Been working on the HTML5 side of my library code, and I kinda made this little demo for fun. Music is Garth Knight’s track Activate the Cage. Ludum Dare 30 is this weekend. Hoo boy! Running that crazyfest is keeping me sooo busy. üôÇ

item.title: Greatest Port Ever (heh)
item.description: Commodore Like Realistic? Heck no! But totally awesome!

item.title: Stocked and Loaded
item.description: An intense month of work awaits. Crunch time, and then some! Early/Mid last week, I spec’d out the plan for my time between now and GDC. Quite a busy schedule, with a lot of really cool things coming up. Smiles stuff, and a quick collaboration with a friend, which I’ll talk more about later. I should have plenty to talk about with my internet colleagues in March. But the icing on the cake was a development Wednesday/Thursday of last week.

item.title: Why iPhone Audio support in Apps is poor
item.description: 3x 2‚Ä≥ binders full of documents. Looks like I have some reading to do. PS: Happy new year. üôÇ

item.title: Technical Difficulties (not really)
item.description: I hate ‚ÄúI’m still here‚Äù posts, but I still feel I owe something. Blame thinking too much, and being busy. I do.

item.title: Today's Threat
item.description: Oh boy! Nothing significant, I just forgot how amusing some of this stuff can be. Taken from 1950’s PSA called ‚ÄúDuck and Cover‚Äú, via Archive.org. Then I started playing with clips from the PSA. Have a good day.

item.title: Patiently waiting dot dot smileyface
item.description: On a side note, DROD: City Beneath is out. You are required to play it.

item.title: Mixed messages
item.description: Nothing says ‚Äúmanly‚Äù like Pine walls, big ass pro-audio ‚Äúmonitor‚Äù speakers, a forklift and space robot having a debate, and a bright pink Kleenex box. Clearly, the speakers are the offending item.

item.title: The plot to overthrow the operation
item.description: A heinous plot unfolded recently to clearly steal our source code, and perhaps our munchies. Fortunately, the culprit was thwarted by the window.

item.title: Post It Crimes
item.description: You think you’re clever, defacing a name-tag using a post it note, and waltzing around the workspace a few days before Halloween. Then someone defaces your name-tag whilst you’re away. The legend lives on.

item.title: The battle that can-not be won
